intro: Spermacoce gardneri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. Its small, white flowers are followed by distinctive, spherical, yellowish fruits that split open to release seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
